chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm)
Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm)
Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher Vaughan Jones was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Christopher Vaughan Jones was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Christopher Vaughan Jones was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christopher Vaughan Jones in court, in custody, with attorney Jennifer Flynn.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 8:

JAIL: 180 Days Straight Time,(apply 45 days credit),  Last 60 days stayed for day report center.  Good time credit to be applied to first 120 days of sentence;  Commencing forthwith.

DAY REPORT CENTER: 60 Days, consecutive to jail sentence.  Good time not allowed on Day Report Center.  If defendant successfully completes the 60 days Day Report Center, the 60 days jail will be permanently stayed. 

COSTS/FEES/RESTIUTITON:  Any outstanding to be converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Christopher Vaughan Jones in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy and attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Cts. 4, 8 and 10. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 4:
- Sentence withheld for 3 years Probation concurrent to Ct. 8 and 10            
- Court Costs of $243.00 - apply bail
- Restitution of $38,230.26 to Patrick B. to be paid as a Condition of Probation. 
- Balance of bail to be held for 2 months for Atty. Lavoy to file a letter regarding other restitution defendant may incur.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent.  No  contact with Patrick B. or Bernard K.. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores).

-  5 days jail with Huber condition time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH concurrent with Ct. 4. Huber with standard release conditions.

-18 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant

- Fine totaling $1179.00 - apply bail

- Sentence withheld for 3 years Probation concurrent to Ct. 4 and 8

Other motions to be addressed at 8:15 a.m. on Tuesday morning - 07/28/2015. Court will not have the jurors ask questions of the witnesses. Jurors will be allowed to take notes. Court will notify parties by 3:00 on Monday if this will be the number 1 trial.

Defendant Christopher Vaughan Jones in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney LaVoy withdraws the motion to dismiss on the record and requests the court set the matter for trial.  The trial is expected to last two days.  The State to confirm with the lab analyst to make sure the trial is #1 for the lab analyst.  If the date is not available for the lab analyst on that date the State is to work with Attorney LaVoy to come up with a mutually agreed upon date that is #1 for the lab analyst and contact the Court's clerk to reschedule.  ALL MOTIONS MUST BE FILED NO LATER THAN 10 DAYS PRIOR TO JURY STATUS HEARING AND MUST BE APPLICABLE TO THE CASE (i.e. NO GENERIC MOTIONS).  A RESPONSE TO ANY MOTION MUST BE FILED TWO DAYS PRIOR TO JURY STATUS HEARING.  THE RESPONSE SHOULD IDENTIFY WHETHER THERE IS ANY OBJECTION TO THE MOTION AND, IF SO, THE SPECIFIC BASIS FOR  THE OBJECTION.  COUNSEL SHOULD MEET AND CONFER TO MAKE A JOINT SUBMISSION OF JURY INSTRUCTIONS, SPECIFICALLY NOTING ANY DISAGREEMENT, AND FILE THOSE WITH THE COURT THE DAY BEFORE THE JURY STATUS ALONG WITH A WITNESS LIST AND ESTIMATE OF THE LENGTH OF THE TRIALJury status hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
